summary: Lakshmi is a major goddess in Hinduism, representing wealth, beauty, and good fortune. She is often shown as a golden woman with a lotus, symbolizing her power over life and spirituality. Lakshmi is part of a trio of goddesses and is closely tied to Vishnu, a major god. She is believed to have appeared in ancient times and is still widely worshipped today. Her influence extends to Southeast Asia, where her images can be found in temples. Festivals like Deepavali celebrate her, and she is seen as a kind of mother figure, offering blessings and guidance.
title: Lakshmi
